intro: Cyathula hereroensis, commonly known as the Herero spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyathula hereroensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
